title: Daily Goals Tracker App (Set, Check Off, and Review)

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and ensure all goal data is scoped per authenticated user principal (unauthenticated users should be prompted to sign in before viewing or editing goals).

quotes: Create an app for my daily goals

acceptanceCriteria: When not signed in, the UI shows a clear sign-in prompt and does not display any private goal data.
After signing in, the user can create and view their own goals.
Two different principals do not see each other’s goals (data is partitioned by principal).

requirements.text: Add backend support for managing daily goals: create, read (list), update, and archive goals, including stable persistence across canister upgrades.

quotes: Create an app for my daily goals

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to create a goal and return its unique id.
Backend exposes methods to list active goals and list archived goals for the calling principal.
Backend exposes methods to update goal fields (at minimum: title; optionally: notes).
Backend exposes a method to archive/unarchive a goal (archived goals are excluded from the default active list).
Goal data remains intact after a redeploy/upgrade (stable state).

requirements.text: Add backend support for tracking daily completion for goals by calendar date (user can check/uncheck a goal for a given day) and retrieving a day view of completion statuses.

quotes: Create an app for my daily goals

acceptanceCriteria: Backend supports setting completion true/false for (goalId, date) for the calling principal.
Backend can return today’s (or a requested date’s) goals with completion state for that date.
Toggling completion updates subsequent fetch results correctly.

requirements.text: Create the core frontend screens for daily goals: Today dashboard (checklist), Goals management (create/edit/archive), and a simple History view to review past days’ completions.

quotes: Create an app for my daily goals

acceptanceCriteria: Today view shows active goals as a checklist with completion state for the selected date (default: today).
User can add a new goal from the UI and see it appear in the active goals list.
User can edit an existing goal’s title and see updates reflected after save.
User can archive a goal and it no longer appears on Today view (but appears in an Archived section).
History view allows selecting a previous date and viewing completion statuses for that date.

requirements.text: Wire the frontend to the backend using React Query for fetching/mutating goals and daily completion, including loading, empty, and error states for each screen.

quotes: Create an app for my daily goals

acceptanceCriteria: All goal lists and day statuses are fetched via React Query queries.
Create/update/archive/toggle-completion actions use React Query mutations and invalidate/refetch the relevant queries.
Each main screen shows a sensible loading state and a readable error message on failure.
Empty states are shown when there are no active goals (with a clear CTA to create one).

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive, creative visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) and use it consistently across all screens; avoid a blue/purple-dominant palette.
acceptanceCriteria: App uses a consistent theme across navigation, headings, buttons, and cards.
Primary palette is not blue/purple-dominant (e.g., warm neutrals/greens/oranges are acceptable).
Layout feels intentional (clear hierarchy, consistent spacing, readable typography).

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets to the frontend and display them in the UI (stored under frontend/public/assets/generated).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
At least the logo is used in the app header/login area, and the empty-state illustration is used when there are no goals.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in the main actor file).
Do not edit any frontend files under the immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose or create new components instead).
Use English for all user-facing UI text.
nonGoals: Notifications, reminders, push messaging, or email delivery.
Third-party authentication providers other than Internet Identity.
External databases or non-Internet-Computer hosting/deployment configuration.

required: Minimalist app logo mark with a checkmark and sun motif, warm neutral palette (daily-goals-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Soft illustrated empty-state scene (desk/journal/checklist), warm tones, lots of whitespace (empty-goals-illustration.dim_1200x800.png)
Subtle repeating background pattern (dots/lines) in light warm gray (warm-pattern-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
